workhead.title: More Nonsense, Pictures, Rhymes, Botany, etc.

notes.note: Teksten f√∏lger The Complete Nonsense of Edward Lear, red. Holbrook Jackson, Faber & Faber 2001.

head.toctitle: One Hundred Nonsense Pictures and Rhymes

head.title: There was an old man of Hong Kong
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Hong Kong
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Hong Kong
head.firstline: There was an old man of Hong Kong

poem.body: There was an old man of Hong Kong, Who never did anything wrong; He lay on his back, with his head in a sack, That innocuous old man of Hong Kong.

head.title: There was an old person of Fife
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Fife
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Fife
head.firstline: There was an old person of Fife

poem.body: There was an old person of Fife, Who was greatly disgusted with life; They sang him a ballad, And fed him on salad, Which cured that old person of Fife.

head.title: There was a young person in green
head.toctitle: There was a young person in green
head.indextitle: There was a young person in green
head.firstline: There was a young person in green

poem.body: There was a young person in green, Who seldom was fit to be seen; She wore a long shawl, over bonnet and all, Which enveloped that person in green.

head.title: There was an old person of Slough
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Slough
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Slough
head.firstline: There was an old person of Slough

poem.body: There was an old person of Slough, Who danced at the end of a bough; But they said, ,,If you sneeze, You might damage the trees, You imprudent old person of Slough.''

head.title: There was an old person of Putney
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Putney
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Putney
head.firstline: There was an old person of Putney

poem.body: There was an old person of Putney, Whose food was roast spiders and chutney, Which he took with his tea, within sight of the sea, That romantic old person of Putney.

head.title: There was a young lady in white
head.toctitle: There was a young lady in white
head.indextitle: There was a young lady in white
head.firstline: There was a young lady in white

poem.body: There was a young lady in white, Who looked out at the depths of the night; But the birds of the air, filled her heart with despair, And oppressed that young lady in white.

head.title: There was an old person of Brill
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Brill
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Brill
head.firstline: There was an old person of Brill

poem.body: There was an old person of Brill, Who purchased a shirt with a frill; But they said, ,,Don't you wish, you may'nt look like a fish, You obsequious ol person of Brill?''

head.title: There was an old man of Three Bridges
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Three Bridges
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Three Bridges
head.firstline: There was an old man of Three Bridges

poem.body: There was an old man of Three Bridges, Whose mind was distracted by midges, He sate on a wheel, eating underdone veal, Which relieved that old man of Three Bridges.

head.title: There was an old person of Wick
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Wick
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Wick
head.firstline: There was an old person of Wick

poem.body: There was an old person of Wick, Who said, ,,Tick-a-Tick, Tick-a-Tick; Chickabee, Chickabaw,'' And he said nothing more, That laconic old person of Wick.

head.title: There was a young lady in blue
head.toctitle: There was a young lady in blue
head.indextitle: There was a young lady in blue
head.firstline: There was a young lady in blue

poem.body: There was a young lady in blue, Who said, ,,Is it you? Is it you?'' When they said, ,,Yes, it is,'' - She replied only, ,,Whizz!'' That ungracious young lady in blue.

head.title: There was an old person of China
head.toctitle: There was an old person of China
head.indextitle: There was an old person of China
head.firstline: There was an old person of China

poem.body: There was an old person of China, Whose daughters were Jiska and Dinah, Amelia and Fluffy, Olivia and Chuffy, And all of them settled in China.

head.title: There was an old man of the Dargle
head.toctitle: There was an old man of the Dargle
head.indextitle: There was an old man of the Dargle
head.firstline: There was an old man of the Dargle

poem.body: There was an old man of the Dargle Who purchased six barrels of Gargle; For he said, ,,I'll sit still, and will roll them down hill, For the fish in the depths of the Dargle.''

head.title: There was an old man in a Marsh
head.toctitle: There was an old man in a Marsh
head.indextitle: There was an old man in a Marsh
head.firstline: There was an old man in a Marsh

poem.body: There was an old man in a Marsh, Whose manners were futile and harsh; He sate on a log, and sang songs to a frog, That instructive old man in a Marsh.

head.title: There was a young person in red
head.toctitle: There was a young person in red
head.indextitle: There was a young person in red
head.firstline: There was a young person in red

poem.body: There was a young person in red, Who carefully covered her head, With a bonnet of leather, and three lines of feather, Besides some long ribands of red.

head.title: There was an old person of Bree
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Bree
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Bree
head.firstline: There was an old person of Bree

poem.body: There was an old person of Bree, Who frequented the depths of the sea; she nurs'd the small fishes, and washed all the dishes, And swam back again into Bree.

head.title: There was an old man in a barge
head.toctitle: There was an old man in a barge
head.indextitle: There was an old man in a barge
head.firstline: There was an old man in a barge

poem.body: There was an old man in a barge, Whose nose was exceedingly large; But in fishing by night, It supported a light, Which helped that old man in a barge.

head.title: There was an old person in black
head.toctitle: There was an old person in black
head.indextitle: There was an old person in black
head.firstline: There was an old person in black

poem.body: There was an old person in black, A Grasshopper jumped on his back; When it chirped in his ear, He was smitten with fear, That helpless old person in black.

head.title: There was an old man of Toulouse
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Toulouse
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Toulouse
head.firstline: There was an old man of Toulouse

poem.body: There was an old man of Toulouse Who purchased a new pair of shoes; When they asked, ,,Are they pleasant?'' - He said, ,,Not at present!'' That turbid old man of Toulouse.

head.title: There was an old man of Blackheath
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Blackheath
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Blackheath
head.firstline: There was an old man of Blackheath

poem.body: There was an old man of Blackheath, Whose head was adorned with a wreath, Of lobsters and spice, pickled onions and mice, That uncommon old man of Blackheath.

head.title: There was an old man on the Humber
head.toctitle: There was an old man on the Humber
head.indextitle: There was an old man on the Humber
head.firstline: There was an old man on the Humber

poem.body: There was an old man on the Humber, Who dined on a cake of burnt Uumber; When he said - ,,It's enough!'' - They only said, ,,Stuff! You amazing old man of the Humber!''

head.title: There was an old person of Stroud
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Stroud
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Stroud
head.firstline: There was an old person of Stroud

poem.body: There was an old person of Stroud, Who was horribly jammed in a crowd; Some she slew with a kick, some she scrunched with a stick, That impulsive old person of Stroud.

head.title: There was an old man of Boulak
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Boulak
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Boulak
head.firstline: There was an old man of Boulak

poem.body: There was an old man of Boulak, Who sate on a Crocodile's back; But they said, ,,Tow'rds the night, he may probably bite, Which might vex you, old man of Boulak!''

head.title: There was an old man of Ibreem
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Ibreem
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Ibreem
head.firstline: There was an old man of Ibreem

poem.body: There was an old man of Ibreem, Who suddenly threaten'd to scream: But they said, ,,If you do, we will thump you quite blue, You disgusting old man of Ibreem!''

head.title: There was an old lady of France
head.toctitle: There was an old lady of France
head.indextitle: There was an old lady of France
head.firstline: There was an old lady of France

poem.body: There was an old lady of France, Who taught little ducklings to dance; When she said, ,,Tick-a-Tack!'' - They only said, ,,Quack!'' Which grieved that old lady of France.

head.title: There was an old man who screamed out
head.toctitle: There was an old man who screamed out
head.indextitle: There was an old man who screamed out
head.firstline: There was an old man who screamed out

poem.body: There was an old man who screamed out Whenever they knocked him about; So they took off his boots, And fed him with fruits, And continued to knock him about.

head.title: There was an old person of Woking
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Woking
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Woking
head.firstline: There was an old person of Woking

poem.body: There was an old person of Woking, Whose mind was perverse and provoking; He sate on a rail, with his head in a pail, That illusive old person of Woking.

head.title: There was a young person of Bantry
head.toctitle: There was a young person of Bantry
head.indextitle: There was a young person of Bantry
head.firstline: There was a young person of Bantry

poem.body: There was a young person of Bantry, Who frequently slept in the pantry; When disturbed by the mice, She appeased them with rice That judicious young person of Bantry.

head.title: There was an Old Man at a Junction
head.toctitle: There was an Old Man at a Junction
head.indextitle: There was an Old Man at a Junction
head.firstline: There was an Old Man at a Junction

poem.body: There was an Old Man at a Junction, Whose feelings were wrung with compunction, When they said, ,,The Train's gone!'' He exclaimed ,,How forlorn!'' But remained on the rails of the Junction.

head.title: There was an old man, who when little
head.toctitle: There was an old man, who when little
head.indextitle: There was an old man, who when little
head.firstline: There was an old man, who when little

poem.body: There was an old man, who when little Fell casually into a kettle; But, growing too stout, He could never get out, So he passed all his life in that kettle.

head.title: There was an old Lady of Winchelsea
head.toctitle: There was an old Lady of Winchelsea
head.indextitle: There was an old Lady of Winchelsea
head.firstline: There was an old Lady of Winchelsea

poem.body: There was an old Lady of Winchelsea, Who said, ,,If you needle or pin shall see, On the floor of my room, sweep it up with the broom!'' - That exhaustive old Lady of of Winchelsea.

head.title: There was a young lady of Firle
head.toctitle: There was a young lady of Firle
head.indextitle: There was a young lady of Firle
head.firstline: There was a young lady of Firle

poem.body: There was a young lady of Firle, Whose hair was addicted to curl; It curled up a tree, and all over the sea, That expansive young lady of Firle.

head.title: There was an old person of Rye
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Rye
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Rye
head.firstline: There was an old person of Rye

poem.body: There was an old person of Rye, Who went up to town on a fly; But they said, ,,If you cough, you are safe to fall off! You abstemious old person of Rye!''

head.title: There was an old man of Messina
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Messina
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Messina
head.firstline: There was an old man of Messina

poem.body: There was an old man of Messina, Whose daughter was named Opsibeena; She wore a small wig, and rode out on a pig, To the perfect delight of Messina.

head.title: There was a young lady, whose nose
head.toctitle: There was a young lady, whose nose
head.indextitle: There was a young lady, whose nose
head.firstline: There was a young lady, whose nose

poem.body: There was a young lady, whose nose, Continually prospers and grows; When it grew out of sight, she exclaimed in a fright, ,,Oh! Farewell to the end of my nose!''

head.title: There was an old person of Cannes
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Cannes
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Cannes
head.firstline: There was an old person of Cannes

poem.body: There was an old person of Cannes, Who purchased three fowls and a fan; Those she placed on a stool, and to make them feel cool She constantly fanned them at Cannes.

head.title: There was an old person of Barnes
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Barnes
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Barnes
head.firstline: There was an old person of Barnes

poem.body: There was an old person of Barnes, Whose garments were covered with darns; But they said, ,,Without doubt, you will soon wear them out, You luminous person of Barnes!''

head.title: There was an old man of Cashmere
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Cashmere
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Cashmere
head.firstline: There was an old man of Cashmere

poem.body: There was an old man of Cashmere, Whose movements were scroobious and queer; Being slender an tall, he looked over a wall, And perceived two fat ducks of Cashmere.

head.title: There was an old person of Hove
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Hove
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Hove
head.firstline: There was an old person of Hove

poem.body: There was an old person of Hove, Who frequented the depths of a grove; Where he studied his books, with the wrens and the rooks, That tranquil old person of Hove.

head.title: There was an old person of Down
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Down
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Down
head.firstline: There was an old person of Down

poem.body: There was an old person of Down, Whose face was adorned with a frown; When he opened the door, for one minute or more, He alarmed all the people of Down.

head.title: There was an old man of Dunluce
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Dunluce
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Dunluce
head.firstline: There was an old man of Dunluce

poem.body: There was an old man of Dunluce, Who went out to sea on a goose: When he'd gone out a mile, he observ'd with a smile, ,,It is time to return to Dunluce.''

head.title: There was a young person of Kew
head.toctitle: There was a young person of Kew
head.indextitle: There was a young person of Kew
head.firstline: There was a young person of Kew

poem.body: There was a young person of Kew, Whose virtues and vices were few; But with blameable haste, she devoured some hot paste, Which destroyed that young person of Kew.

head.title: There was an old person of Sark
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Sark
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Sark
head.firstline: There was an old person of Sark

poem.body: There was an old person of Sark, Who made an unpleasant remark; But they said, ,,Don't you see what a brute you must be!'' You obnoxious old person of Sark.

head.title: There was an old person of Filey
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Filey
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Filey
head.firstline: There was an old person of Filey

poem.body: There was an old person of Filey, Of whom his acquaintance spoke highly; He danced perfectly well, to the sound of a bell, And delighted the people of Filey.

head.title: There was an old man of El Hums
head.toctitle: There was an old man of El Hums
head.indextitle: There was an old man of El Hums
head.firstline: There was an old man of El Hums

poem.body: There was an old man of El Hums, Who lived upon nothing but crumbs, Which he picked off the ground, with the other birds round, In the roads and the lanes of El Hums.

head.title: There was an old man of West Dumpet
head.toctitle: There was an old man of West Dumpet
head.indextitle: There was an old man of West Dumpet
head.firstline: There was an old man of West Dumpet

poem.body: There was an old man of West Dumpet, Who possessed a large nose like a trumpet; When he blew it aloud, it astonished the crowd, And was heard through the whole of West Dumpet.

head.title: There was an old man of Port Grigor
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Port Grigor
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Port Grigor
head.firstline: There was an old man of Port Grigor

poem.body: There was an old man of Port Grigor, Whose actions were noted for vigour; He stood on his head, till his waistcoat turned red, That eclectic old man of Port Grigor.

head.title: There was an old person of Bar
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Bar
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Bar
head.firstline: There was an old person of Bar

poem.body: There was an old person of Bar, Who passed all her life in a jar, Which she painted pea-green, to appear more serene, That placid old person of Bar.

head.title: There was an old person of Pett
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Pett
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Pett
head.firstline: There was an old person of Pett

poem.body: There was an old person of Pett, Who was partly consumed by regret; He sate in a cart, and ate cold apple tart, Which relieved that old person of Pett.

head.title: There was an old person of Newry
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Newry
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Newry
head.firstline: There was an old person of Newry

poem.body: There was an old person of Newry, Whose manners were tinctured with fury; He tore all the rugs, and broke all the jugs Within twenty miles' distance of Newry.

head.title: There was an old person of Jodd
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Jodd
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Jodd
head.firstline: There was an old person of Jodd

poem.body: There was an old person of Jodd, Whose ways were perplexing and odd; She purchased a whistle, and sate on a thistle, And squeaked to the people of Jodd.

head.title: There was an old person of Shoreham
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Shoreham
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Shoreham
head.firstline: There was an old person of Shoreham

poem.body: There was an old person of Shoreham, Whose habits were marked by decorum; He bought an Umbrella, and sate in the cellar, Which pleased all the people of Shoreham.

head.title: There was an old man of Dumbree
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Dumbree
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Dumbree
head.firstline: There was an old man of Dumbree

poem.body: There was an old man of Dumbree, Who taught little owls to drink tea; For he said, ,,To eat mice, is not proper or nice'' That amiable man of Dumbree.

head.title: There was an old person of Wilts
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Wilts
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Wilts
head.firstline: There was an old person of Wilts

poem.body: There was an old person of Wilts, Who constantly walked upon stilts; He wreathed them with lilies, and daffy-down-dilies, That elegant person of Wilts.

head.title: There was an old man whose remorse
head.toctitle: There was an old man whose remorse
head.indextitle: There was an old man whose remorse
head.firstline: There was an old man whose remorse

poem.body: There was an old man whose remorse, Induced him to drink Caper Sauce; For they said, ,,If mixed up, with some cold claret-cup, It will certainly soothe your remorse!''

head.title: There was an old person of Cassel
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Cassel
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Cassel
head.firstline: There was an old person of Cassel

poem.body: There was an old person of Cassel, Whose nose finished off in a tassel; But they call'd out, ,,Oh well! - don't it look like a bell!'' Which perplexed that old person of Cassel.

head.title: There was a young person of Janina
head.toctitle: There was a young person of Janina
head.indextitle: There was a young person of Janina
head.firstline: There was a young person of Janina

poem.body: There was a young person of Janina, Whose uncle was always a fanning her; When he fanned off her head, she smiled sweetly, and said, ,,You propitious old person of Janina!''

head.title: There was an old person of Ware
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Ware
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Ware
head.firstline: There was an old person of Ware

poem.body: There was an old person of Ware, Who rode on the back of a bear: When they ask'd, - ,,Does it trot?'' - he said ,,Certainly not! He's a Moppsikon Floppsikon bear!''

head.title: There was an old person of Dean
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Dean
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Dean
head.firstline: There was an old person of Dean

poem.body: There was an old person of Dean, Who dined on one pea, and one bean; For he said, ,,More than that, would make me too fat,'' That cautious old person of Dean.

head.title: There was an old person of Dundalk
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Dundalk
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Dundalk
head.firstline: There was an old person of Dundalk

poem.body: There was an old person of Dundalk, Who tried to teach fishes to walk; When they tumbled down dead, he grew weary, and said, ,,I had better go back to Dundalk!''

head.title: There was a young person of Ayr
head.toctitle: There was a young person of Ayr
head.indextitle: There was a young person of Ayr
head.firstline: There was a young person of Ayr

poem.body: There was a young person of Ayr, Whose head was remarkably square: On the top, in fine weather, she wore a gold feather; Which dazzled the people of Ayr.

head.title: There was an old person of Skye
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Skye
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Skye
head.firstline: There was an old person of Skye

poem.body: There was an old person of Skye, Who waltz'd with a Bluebottle fly: They buzz'd a sweet tune, to the light of the moon, And entranced all the people of Skye.

head.title: There was an old man of Dumblane
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Dumblane
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Dumblane
head.firstline: There was an old man of Dumblane

poem.body: There was an old man of Dumblane, Who greatly resembled a crane; But they said, - ,,Is it wrong, since your legs are so long, To request you won't stay in Dumblane?''

head.title: There was an old person of Hyde
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Hyde
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Hyde
head.firstline: There was an old person of Hyde

poem.body: There was an old person of Hyde, Who walked by the shore with his bride, Till a Crab who came near, fill'd their bosoms with fear, And they said, ,,Would we'd never left Hyde!''

head.title: There was an old person of Rimini
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Rimini
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Rimini
head.firstline: There was an old person of Rimini

poem.body: There was an old person of Rimini, Who said, ,,Gracious! Goodness! Oh Gimini!'' When they said, ,,Please be still!'' she ran down a hill, And was never more heard of at Rimini.

head.title: There was an old man in a tree
head.toctitle: There was an old man in a tree
head.indextitle: There was an old man in a tree
head.firstline: There was an old man in a tree

poem.body: There was an old man in a tree, Whose whiskers were lovely to see; But the birds of the air, pluck'd them perfectly bare, To make themselves nests in that tree.

head.title: There was a young lady of Corsica
head.toctitle: There was a young lady of Corsica
head.indextitle: There was a young lady of Corsica
head.firstline: There was a young lady of Corsica

poem.body: There was a young lady of Corsica, Who purchased a little brown saucy-cur; Which she fed upon ham, and hot raspberry jam, That expensive young lady of Corsica.

head.title: There was an old person of Bray
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Bray
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Bray
head.firstline: There was an old person of Bray

poem.body: There was an old person of Bray, Who sang through the whole of the day To his ducks and his pigs, whom he fed upon figs, That valuable person of Bray.

head.title: There was an old person of Sestri
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Sestri
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Sestri
head.firstline: There was an old person of Sestri

poem.body: There was an old person of Sestri, Who sate himself down in a vestry, When they said ,,You are wrong!'' - he merely said ,,Bong!'' That repulsive old person of Sestri.

head.title: There was an old person of Bude
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Bude
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Bude
head.firstline: There was an old person of Bude

poem.body: There was an old person of Bude, Whose deportment was vicious and crude; He wore a large ruff, of pale straw-coloured stuff, Which perplexed all the people of Bude.

head.title: There was an old person of Bow
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Bow
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Bow
head.firstline: There was an old person of Bow

poem.body: There was an old person of Bow, Whom nobody happened to know; So they gave him some soap, and said coldly, ,,We hope You will go back directly to Bow!''

head.title: There was a young lady of Greenwich
head.toctitle: There was a young lady of Greenwich
head.indextitle: There was a young lady of Greenwich
head.firstline: There was a young lady of Greenwich

poem.body: There was a young lady of Greenwich, Whose garments were bordered with Spinach; But a large spotty Calf, bit her shawl quite in half, Which alarmed that young lady of Greenwich.

head.title: There was an old person of Brigg
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Brigg
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Brigg
head.firstline: There was an old person of Brigg

poem.body: There was an old person of Brigg, Who purchased no end of a wig; So that only his nose, and the end of his toes, Could be seen when he walked about Brigg.

head.title: There was an old person of Crowle
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Crowle
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Crowle
head.firstline: There was an old person of Crowle

poem.body: There was an old person of Crowle, Who lived in the nest of an owl; When they screamed in the nest, he screamed out with the rest, That depressing old person of Crowle.

head.title: There was an old person in gray
head.toctitle: There was an old person in gray
head.indextitle: There was an old person in gray
head.firstline: There was an old person in gray

poem.body: There was an old person in gray, Whose feeling were tinged with dismay; She purchased two parrots, and fed them with carrots, Which pleased that old person in gray.

head.title: There was an old person of Blythe
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Blythe
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Blythe
head.firstline: There was an old person of Blythe

poem.body: There was an old person of Blythe, Who cut up his meat with a scythe; When they said, ,,Well! I never!'' - he cried, ,,Scythes for ever!'' That lively old person of Blythe.

head.title: There was an old person of Ealing
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Ealing
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Ealing
head.firstline: There was an old person of Ealing

poem.body: There was an old person of Ealing, Who was wholly devoid of good feeling; He drove a small gig, with three Owls and a Pig, Which distressed all the people of Ealing.

head.title: There was an old person of Ickley
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Ickley
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Ickley
head.firstline: There was an old person of Ickley

poem.body: There was an old person of Ickley, Who could not abide to ride quickly, He rode to Karnak, on a tortoise's back, That moony old person of Ickley.

head.title: There was an old man of Ancona
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Ancona
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Ancona
head.firstline: There was an old man of Ancona

poem.body: There was an old man of Ancona, Who found a small dog with no owner, Whic he took up and down, all the streets of the town; That anxious old man of Ancona.

head.title: There was an old person of Grange
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Grange
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Grange
head.firstline: There was an old person of Grange

poem.body: There was an old person of Grange, Whose manners were scroobious and strange; He sailed to St. Blubb, in a waterproof tub, That aquatic old person of Grange.

head.title: There was an old person of Nice
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Nice
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Nice
head.firstline: There was an old person of Nice

poem.body: There was an old person of Nice, Whose associates were usually Geese. They walked out together, in all sorts of weather. That affable person of Nice!

head.title: There was an old person of Deal
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Deal
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Deal
head.firstline: There was an old person of Deal

head.title: There was an old man of Thermopyl√¶
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Thermopyl√¶
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Thermopyl√¶
head.firstline: There was an old man of Thermopyl√¶

poem.body: There was an old man of Thermopyl√¶, Who never did anything properly; But they said, ,,If you choose, To boil eggs in your shoes, You shall never remain in Thermopyl√¶.''

head.title: There was an old person of Minety
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Minety
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Minety
head.firstline: There was an old person of Minety

poem.body: There was an old person of Minety Who purchased five hundred and ninety Large apples and pears, which he threw unawares, At the heads of the people of Minety.

head.title: There was an old man whose despair
head.toctitle: There was an old man whose despair
head.indextitle: There was an old man whose despair
head.firstline: There was an old man whose despair

poem.body: There was an old man whose despair Induced him to purchase a hare: Whereon one fine day, he rode wholly away, Which partly assuaged his despair.

head.title: There was an old person of Pinner
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Pinner
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Pinner
head.firstline: There was an old person of Pinner

poem.body: There was an old person of Pinner, As thin as a lath, if not thinner; They dressed him in white, and roll'd him up tight, That elastic old person of Pinner.

head.title: There was an old person of Bromley
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Bromley
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Bromley
head.firstline: There was an old person of Bromley

poem.body: There was an old person of Bromley, Whose ways were not cheerful or comely; He sate in the dust, eating spiders and crust, That unpleasing old person of Bromley.

head.title: There was an old man of Dunrose
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Dunrose
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Dunrose
head.firstline: There was an old man of Dunrose

poem.body: There was an old man of Dunrose; A parrot seized hold of his nose. When he grew melancholy, They said, ,,His name's Polly,'' Which soothed that old man of Dunrose.

head.title: There was an old man on the Border
head.toctitle: There was an old man on the Border
head.indextitle: There was an old man on the Border
head.firstline: There was an old man on the Border

poem.body: There was an old man on the Border, Who lived in the utmost disorder; He danced with the cat, and made tea in his hat, Which vexed all the folks on the Border.

head.title: There was an old man of Spithead
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Spithead
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Spithead
head.firstline: There was an old man of Spithead

poem.body: There was an old man of Spithead, Who opened the window, and said, - ,,Fil-jomble, fil-jumble, Fil-rumble-come-tumble!'' That doubtful old man of Spithead.

head.title: There was an old person of Sheen
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Sheen
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Sheen
head.firstline: There was an old person of Sheen

poem.body: There was an old person of Sheen, Whose expression was calm and serene; He sate in the water, and drank bottled porter, That placid old person of Sheen.

head.title: There was an old person of Florence
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Florence
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Florence
head.firstline: There was an old person of Florence

poem.body: There was an old person of Florence, Who held mutton chops in abhorrence; He purchased a Bustard, and fried him in Mustard, Which choked that old person of Florence.

head.title: There was an old person of Loo
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Loo
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Loo
head.firstline: There was an old person of Loo

poem.body: There was an old person of Loo, Who said, ,,What on earth shall I do?'' When they said, ,,Go away!'' - she continued to stay, That vexatious old person of Loo.

head.title: There was an old person of Pisa
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Pisa
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Pisa
head.firstline: There was an old person of Pisa

poem.body: There was an old person of Pisa, Whose daughters did nothing to please her; She dressed them in gray, and bonged them all day, Round the walls of the city of Pisa.

head.title: There was an old man in a garden
head.toctitle: There was an old man in a garden
head.indextitle: There was an old man in a garden
head.firstline: There was an old man in a garden

poem.body: There was an old man in a garden, Who always begg'd every-one's pardon; When they asked him, ,,What for?'' - He replied, ,,You're a bore! And I trust you'll go out of my garden.''

head.title: There was an old man of Thames Ditton
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Thames Ditton
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Thames Ditton
head.firstline: There was an old man of Thames Ditton

poem.body: There was an old man of Thames Ditton, Who called for something to sit on; But they brought him a hat, and said - ,,Sit upon that, You abruptious old man of Thames Ditton!''

head.title: There was an old man of Dee-side
head.toctitle: There was an old man of Dee-side
head.indextitle: There was an old man of Dee-side
head.firstline: There was an old man of Dee-side

poem.body: There was an old man of Dee-side, Whose hat was exceedingly wide, But he said, ,,Do not fail, If it happens to hail To come under my hat at Dee-side!''

head.title: There was an old man at a Station
head.toctitle: There was an old man at a Station
head.indextitle: There was an old man at a Station
head.firstline: There was an old man at a Station

poem.body: There was an old man at a Station, Who made a promiscuous oration; But they said, ,,Take some snuff! - You have talk'd quite enough You afflicting old man at a Station!''

head.title: There was an old person of Shields
head.toctitle: There was an old person of Shields
head.indextitle: There was an old person of Shields
head.firstline: There was an old person of Shields

poem.body: There was an old person of Shields, Who frequented the valley and fields; All the mice and the cats, And the snakes and the rats, Followed after that person of Shields.

head.title: There was a young person in pink
head.toctitle: There was a young person in pink
head.indextitle: There was a young person in pink
head.firstline: There was a young person in pink

poem.body: There was a young person in pink, Who called out for something to drink; But they said, ,,Oh my daughter, There's nothing but water!'' Which vexed that young person in pink.

head.title: There was a young person whose history
head.toctitle: There was a young person whose history
head.indextitle: There was a young person whose history
head.firstline: There was a young person whose history

poem.body: There was a young person whose history, Was always considered a mystery; She sate in a ditch, although no one knew which, And composed a small treatise on history.
